alert.note: Alert for Logan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Logan County through 545 PM EDT... At 510 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Man, or 7 miles south of Logan, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Mount Gay-Shamrock, Holden, West Logan, Mount Gay, Verdunville, Chauncey, Sarah Ann and Switzer. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 21 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
